ref: 2654 kaḍambī f. ʻ the potherb Convolvulus repens ʼ, ˚ba- m. Car., kalambī -- , ˚bikā -- , ˚bū -- , ˚bukā -- f. lex. [See kadambá -- ]
Pa. kalamba -- m., ˚bukā -- f. ʻ a potherb, prob. Convolvulus repens ʼ;
Pk. kalaṁbu -- , ˚buā -- f. ʻ a kind of creeper ʼ, ˚bugā -- f. ʻ a kind of water plant ʼ;
B. kalmi ʻ a rapidly growing aquatic creeper, C. repens ʼ;
Or. kaṛambī ʻ an edible aquatic creeper ʼ, kaḷama ʻ do., Ipomoea aquatica ʼ;
H. kalmī f. ʻ C. repens ʼ, karemū m. ʻ an aquatic grass used as an antidote to opium ʼ.
